meanings.definition: In a manner lacking value or usefulness.
meanings.sent1: She completed the task worthlessly, without achieving anything.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy lay worthlessly in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail worthlessly, never catching it.
meanings.sent4: His promises of help turned out to be worthlessly empty.
meanings.sent5: The old computer sat worthlessly on the desk, unable to turn on.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is without worth or merit.
meanings.sent1: The student answered the question worthlessly, showing no understanding.
meanings.sent2: The thief stole the necklace and then tossed it worthlessly aside.
meanings.sent3: The chef added salt worthlessly to the already salty soup.
meanings.sent5: The broken clock ticked worthlessly, unable to tell the time.
